snippet: Mayor Bill de Blasio has promised to phase out New York City’s carriage horses, but the plan may place unintended stress on the rest of the horse population.
abstract: Jim Dwyer About New York column questions whether Mayor Bill de Blasio's plan to rid city of carriage horses will benefit horses or just people who want to develop valuable Midtown properties where stables stand; mentions some possible unintended consequences of plan, which would only affect carriage horses, not city-owned mounted police patrols.
lead_paragraph: Mayor Bill de Blasio has promised to phase out New York City’s carriage horses, but the plan may place unintended stress on the rest of the horse population.

headline.main: Carriage Horse Proposal’s Effects Might Not Be as Good as Its Intentions
headline.print_headline: A Proposal Whose Effects Might Not Be as Good as Its Intentions

keywords.value: New Yorkers for Clean, Livable and Safe Streets
keywords.name: organizations
